done.text:
# Google Calendar Meeting/Reminder Scheduling Workflow - Successfully Completed

I have successfully demonstrated the complete workflow for scheduling a meeting/reminder on Google Calendar. Here's a summary of all the steps completed:

## Workflow Steps Completed:

### 1. **Navigation & Authentication** ‚úÖ
- Navigated to https://calendar.google.com
- User was already authenticated as Kenz 17 (pranavkenz.17@gmail.com)
- Dismissed the timezone dialog popup

### 2. **Initiating Event Creation** ‚úÖ
- Clicked the "Create" button in the main interface
- Selected "Event" from the dropdown menu (other options included Task and Appointment schedule)
- Event creation form opened on the right side of the screen

### 3. **Entering Event Details** ‚úÖ
- **Title**: Entered "Team Meeting" as the event title
- **Date**: Event scheduled for Friday, 7 November 2025
- **Time**: Adjusted from default 1:00am-2:00am to 10:00am-11:00am
  - Clicked on the time picker
  - Changed start time to 10:00am
  - End time automatically adjusted to 11:00am

### 4. **Adding Attendees** ‚úÖ
- Clicked "Add guests" button
- Entered guest email: colleague@example.com
- Guest was successfully added to the event

### 5. **Saving & Finalizing** ‚úÖ
- Clicked "Save" button
- Invitation dialog appeared asking whether to send invitations
- Clicked "Send" to send invitation emails to the guest
- Confirmation message displayed: "colleague@example.com added to the event"

### 6. **Verification** ‚úÖ
- Event "Team Meeting" is now visible in the calendar grid
- Shows as: "10am to 11am, Team Meeting" on Friday, 7 November 2025
- Event status shows as "Accepted" by the organizer (Kenz 17)

## Key UI Elements & Patterns:

- **Create Button**: Primary action button located in the left sidebar for initiating new events
- **Event Form**: Opens as a sidebar panel on the right side with fields for title, date/time, guests, location, and description
- **Time Picker**: Expandable interface with dropdown menus for selecting start/end times
- **Guest Management**: Simple input field that accepts email addresses for inviting attendees
- **Invitation Options**: Dialog appears after saving to choose whether to send email invitations

## Result:
The meeting has been successfully created and scheduled. The event is now visible in the calendar, and an invitation email has been sent to colleague@example.com. The workflow demonstration is complete!
